post.title: If you shit-post once a minute in all and people downvote you it isn't brigading

body:
Yep. I posted a thread about this on +stopbrigading. Dude is calling for Ruqqus censorship, and he gets downvoted (as is right) and then he complains he's been "brigaded". 

I wish there was a solution to this. Ruqqus marks reposts with a big yellow Repost tag, and I think that's great. I wish there were a solution like that for "brigaded" posts, but it's so difficult to separate the actual unpopular opinions from the "brigaded" ones. 

At the end of the day, I'm inclined to trust the votes. If you get downvoted, it's because you posted something unpopular. And maybe you pissed off someone capable of bot-downvoting you. Whatever the cause, I choose to trust the rep score.

body: Not just that, there is also the "madness of crowds" or as its recently called "echo chamber" phenomenon. Even if your post isn't shit but just controversial or favoring the opposite camp, a lot of people might still downvote you due to the herd effect. That is also not brigading.

parent.body:
Yep. I posted a thread about this on +stopbrigading. Dude is calling for Ruqqus censorship, and he gets downvoted (as is right) and then he complains he's been "brigaded". 

I wish there was a solution to this. Ruqqus marks reposts with a big yellow Repost tag, and I think that's great. I wish there were a solution like that for "brigaded" posts, but it's so difficult to separate the actual unpopular opinions from the "brigaded" ones. 

At the end of the day, I'm inclined to trust the votes. If you get downvoted, it's because you posted something unpopular. And maybe you pissed off someone capable of bot-downvoting you. Whatever the cause, I choose to trust the rep score.

body:
But that's how groups of humans and group thinking works, whether you call them cults, tribes, clubs, echo chambers or anything else, the group mindset still remains. For example, if an expert in the group (such as a doctor or accountant or computer engineer) makes a negative statement, you will definitely rely on the judgment of your fellow group member even if you cannot personally verify yourself what the *someone else* claimed to have tested. 

Another example: If your trusted doctor or GP proclaims that a certain company in your city is doing organ harvesting, will you not blindly go and downvote that company's social media pages? Or will you have doubts about your GP's skills?
body_html:
But that's how groups of humans and group thinking works, whether you call them cults, tribes, clubs, echo chambers or anything else, the group mindset still remains. For example, if an expert in the group (such as a doctor or accountant or computer engineer) makes a negative statement, you will definitely rely on the judgment of your fellow group member even if you cannot personally verify yourself what the someone else claimed to have tested.

Another example: If your trusted doctor or GP proclaims that a certain company in your city is doing organ harvesting, will you not blindly go and downvote that company's social media pages? Or will you have doubts about your GP's skills?

body:
When I hear people like this I hear that one kid who deliberately acts weird on purpose and eats their boogers for laughs/candy, whinging no one on the playground will pick them for their team. I get downvoted, too. I don't bitch about it. It only took me a few months to get to the coveted 1000 rep, and I lost over 160 reps during the last "bug" fix-- I only bitched about that a tiny little bit. When the CPT explained, I was just, Aye-aye, sir, carry on with your bad self. 

Mostly I wish people would stop suggesting dumb shit to "fix" shit that ain't broke. This ain't Reddit. Stop trying to turn it into the Bad Place. We left there for reasons. 

And for Christ's sake.... Be patient, post some more and wait for the votes. This isn't fast food. Pay your dues like the rest of us

![](https://i.ibb.co/B4DGp4V/Not-a-master.jpg)
body_html:
When I hear people like this I hear that one kid who deliberately acts weird on purpose and eats their boogers for laughs/candy, whinging no one on the playground will pick them for their team. I get downvoted, too. I don't bitch about it. It only took me a few months to get to the coveted 1000 rep, and I lost over 160 reps during the last "bug" fix-- I only bitched about that a tiny little bit. When the CPT explained, I was just, Aye-aye, sir, carry on with your bad self.

Mostly I wish people would stop suggesting dumb shit to "fix" shit that ain't broke. This ain't Reddit. Stop trying to turn it into the Bad Place. We left there for reasons.

And for Christ's sake.... Be patient, post some more and wait for the votes. This isn't fast food. Pay your dues like the rest of us
